servinfo.title: Radiator Cooling Fan High Speed Control System Check

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to Radiator Cooling Fan Low Speed Control System Check .

attention1.ptxt: Keep hands, tools, and clothing away from engine cooling fan to help prevent personal injury. This fan is electric and can come on whether or not the engine is running. The fan can start automatically in response to the ECT sensor with the ignition switch at the “ON” position.

item.ptxt: Before performed troubleshooting, be sure to read the Precautions of ECM Circuit Inspection .
When measuring circuit voltage, resistance and/or pulse signal at ECM connector, connect the special tool to ECM and/or the ECM connectors referring to Inspection of ECM and Its Circuits .

testgroup.question: Is there DTC(s) of ECT sensor circuit (DTC P0116 / P0117 / P0118) and/or radiator cooling fan circuit (DTC P0480)?

testgroup.title: Low speed radiator cooling fan control circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Start engine and select “DATA LIST” mode on scan tool.
Warm up engine until coolant temp. is 97.5 °C, 207.5 °F or higher and A/C switch turns OFF (if equipped with A/C). (If engine coolant temp. dose not rise, check engine cooling system or ECT sensor.)

testgroup.question: Is radiator cooling fan started at low speed when engine coolant temp. reached above temp.?

action.ptxt: Perform from Step 2 to Step 5 in Radiator Cooling Fan Low Speed Control System Check .

testgroup.title: High speed radiator cooling fan control circuit check

test1.ptxt: Start engine and select “DATA LIST” mode on scan tool.
Warm up engine until coolant temp. is 102.5 °C, 216.5 °F or higher and A/C switch turns OFF (if equipped with A/C). (If engine coolant temp. dose not rise, check engine cooling system or ECT sensor.)

testgroup.question: Is radiator cooling fan started at high speed when engine coolant temp. reached above temp?

action.ptxt: Radiator cooling fan control system is in good condition.

paragroup.ptxt: Perform from Step 8 to Step 19 in DTC P0480 diag. flow.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect radiator cooling fan relay No.3 from relay box with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “BLU/BLK” wire terminal of radiator cooling fan relay No.3 connector and vehicle body ground.
Disconnect connector from radiator cooling fan motor No.2 with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “BLU” wire terminal of radiator cooling fan relay No.3 connector and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: “BLU” wire is shorted to other circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “BLU” wire terminals of radiator cooling fan relay No.3 connector and radiator cooling fan motor No.2 connector with ignition switch turned OFF.

action.ptxt: “BLU” wire is open or high resistances.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect radiator cooling fan relay No.2 from relay box.
Measure resistance between “BLK” wire terminal of radiator cooling fan relay No.2 connector and vehicle body ground.
Check radiator cooling fan relay referring to Radiator Cooling Fan Relay Inspection .
Check radiator cooling fan motor referring to Radiator Cooling Fan Motor On-Vehicle Inspection .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
